{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3497787,"name":"mjbergman92","username":"mjbergman92","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/mjbergman92/{size}/219086_2.png","created_at":"2025-01-31T13:44:35.382Z","cooked":"

I am able to re create this issue on several computers.

Shuffleboard become unresponsive when I attempt to interact with layouts on a tab created in code.

This is how we test and calibrate. If there is a workaround, I’d be open to it.

Here is our code. We commented out the telemetry for elevator because it’s causing shuffleboard to freeze. Maybe it’s the suppliers causing the issue, idk.

Shuffleboard is slowly becoming abandonware. If you are using it for advanced stuff, i would suggest migrating over to software created last year and maintained this year:

Elastic 2025: A Lot of Little Things Programming
[Elastic Logo] I’m happy to begin initial 2025 beta testing for Elastic. For those who aren’t familiar with Elastic, it’s a Flutter driver dashboard that acts as a drop in replacement for Shuffleboard, with a nicer UI, network optimizations, and more customizability. Elastic was initially released last year, and I was blown away by the community response. [2025 Demo Layout] What Changed? Overall, not much on the outside. The interface and UX is extremely similar, but the differences lie in …
QFRCDashboard 2025: a performant, reliable, aesthetic driver dashboard Technical
QFRCDashboard is officially ready for the 2025 season! QFRCDashboard is an extremely lightweight, high-performance dashboard, designed to be aesthetically pleasing & easy to look at during a match, all while taking up as few driver station resources as possible. [image] Performance QFRCDashboard utilizes the very high efficiency & low resource cost of the Qt framework and its QML GUI to ensure that as many resources can be allocated to the driver station app as possible. Additionally, widget &…

Stampede Robotics"},"post_url":"/t/shuffleboard-causing-high-pc-cpu-usage-and-unresponsive/484468/2","custom_user_title":"3630 Assistant Coach - Stampede Robotics","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":2}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":true,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3497800,"name":"Scott W","username":"Programming4907","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/programming4907/{size}/168313_2.png","created_at":"2025-01-31T13:55:02.099Z","cooked":"

We stopped using shuffleboard in 2022 due to high CPU usage on our laptop. We went back to SmartDashboard, which while it isn’t pretty, still seems to work consistently with much less CPU load.

Shuffleboard has a design flaw where every NT update causes a UI refresh on each event. It would be better if they just did a full refresh at a set interval and did all the rendering at the same time.

We are switching to Elastic this year, also part of WpiLib and just the next evolution of Shuffleboard. It works well and feels familiar to Shuffleboard.

","post_number":4,"post_type":1,"posts_count":10,"updated_at":"2025-01-31T13:58:42.926Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":66,"readers_count":65,"score":18.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":484468,"topic_slug":"shuffleboard-causing-high-pc-cpu-usage-and-unresponsive","display_username":"Steven Carmain","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":1737,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Programmer/Drive Coach"},"post_url":"/t/shuffleboard-causing-high-pc-cpu-usage-and-unresponsive/484468/4","custom_user_title":"Programmer/Drive Coach","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3497810,"name":"","username":"crueter","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/crueter/{size}/258043_2.png","created_at":"2025-01-31T14:03:37.952Z","cooked":"
Steven_Carmain:

Shuffleboard has a design flaw where every NT update causes a UI refresh on each event

This isn’t necessarily an issue; both are totally valid approaches. There are a LOT of issues surrounding its UI performance not the least of which is the relative inefficiency of the Java VM.

I will look into these. I still thought Shuffleboard was the goto.

Programming4907:

We went back to SmartDashboard

I had to do that as well; however, I need graphs and such, and the layout of Smartdashboard can have it’s own setbacks.

","post_number":6,"post_type":1,"posts_count":10,"updated_at":"2025-01-31T16:34:58.524Z","reply_count":2,"reply_to_post_number":2,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":37,"readers_count":36,"score":17.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":484468,"topic_slug":"shuffleboard-causing-high-pc-cpu-usage-and-unresponsive","display_username":"mjbergman92","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":30247,"username":"vargoose84","name":"vargoose84","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/vargoose84/{size}/165453_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":29382,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/shuffleboard-causing-high-pc-cpu-usage-and-unresponsive/484468/6","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3497944,"name":"Peter Johnson","username":"Peter_Johnson","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/peter_johnson/{size}/10417_2.png","created_at":"2025-01-31T16:39:40.371Z","cooked":"
mjbergman92:

I need graphs and such

If you want graphs, I would recommend AdvantageScope or Glass, which are programmer focused. We’ve seen a bifurcation emerge in dashboards—driver focused ones like Elastic, and programmer/debugging focused ones like AdvantageScope and Glass.

Both Shuffleboard and SmartDashboard will be retired in 2027, it’s time for teams to start transitioning to alternatives.

Have you tried QFRCDashboard yet? It has most of the features of Shuffleboard but no where near as much resource consumption?

QFRCDashboard 2025: a performant, reliable, aesthetic driver dashboard Technical
QFRCDashboard is officially ready for the 2025 season! QFRCDashboard is an extremely lightweight, high-performance dashboard, designed to be aesthetically pleasing & easy to look at during a match, all while taking up as few driver station resources as possible. [image] Performance QFRCDashboard utilizes the very high efficiency & low resource cost of the Qt framework and its QML GUI to ensure that as many resources can be allocated to the driver station app as possible. Additionally, widget…

I would highly recommend this for laptops which are notoriously bad at processing anything.

I will have to see about Elastic dashboard and QFRCDashboard.

I already see the switching of the dashboard in QFRCDashboard when the robot state changes could be useful… again, I will have to test and see.

Maybe we will use both depending on testing or competition.

Thank you all for the suggestions.

Thank you for the update. I must have missed the depreciation notice for Smartdashboard and Shuffleboard.

AdvantageScope is going to be helpful when we have some time to really dig into it. I find it almost TOO feature rich. I went to the conferences that Jonah and 6328 put on at worlds and it’s already made a big impact. I’m sure we will adopt it sometime soon.
